content.text:
<think>
Opening scene for Aric, Level 1 Fighter, curious scholar in a quiet library. Character creation complete, adventure begins. Need full JSON response with session_header, narrative, planning_block, state_updates with world_time, etc.
</think>

<final>

```json
{
  "session_header": "[SESSION_HEADER]\nTimestamp: 1492 DR, Mirtul 3, 09:15:00\nLocation: The Athenaeum of Veiled Pages\nStatus: Lvl 1 Fighter | HP: 12/12 | XP: 0/300 | Gold: 10gp",
  "resources": "HD: 1/1 (d10), No Spells (Fighter), Second Wind: 1/1, Potions: 0, Exhaustion: 0",
  "narrative": "Morning (09:15:00) in the Athenaeum of Veiled Pages—pale shafts of light filter through tall, dust-caked windows, illuminating columns of motes that drift like tiny constellations between the towering shelves. The library is vast, far larger than its modest stone exterior suggests, its corridors branching and folding back on themselves in ways that seem to defy the building's footprint. The air smells of parchment, old leather, and something faintly metallic—like ink left too long in a copper well.\n\nAric (Lvl 1) sits at a scarred oak reading table near the center of the main hall, surrounded by a careful arrangement of opened tomes. His longsword leans against the table leg, out of place among the quills and bookmarks, but he has learned that a scholar who ventures into forgotten stacks should never go unarmed. The last three who tried to catalogue the Athenaeum's restricted wing were never seen again—or so the elderly custodian, Brenneth (Lvl 2), likes to remind him every morning.\n\nSpeaking of Brenneth—the old man shuffles between the shelves nearby, pushing a rattling cart of returns. He pauses, peers over his half-moon spectacles at Aric, and clears his throat.\n\n\"You're at it again.\" His voice is dry as the pages he tends. \"That's the third morning this week I've found you nose-deep in the Tessaran Index. Most folk who come asking about the Veiled Collection lose interest after the first warning.\" He sets a leather-bound volume on the cart with deliberate care. \"You're either very determined or very foolish. Possibly both.\"\n\nHe leans closer, lowering his voice. \"But since you're still here—I found something last night. Wedged behind a shelf in the east corridor. A journal. Old. Older than most things in this building, and that's saying something.\" His rheumy eyes sharpen. \"The handwriting matches the marginalia in that index you've been studying. Whoever wrote your annotations... wrote this journal too.\"\n\nBrenneth straightens, glancing toward the east corridor—a narrow passage between two towering bookshelf rows that disappears into shadow. \"It's still where I found it. Didn't want to move it. Didn't want to touch it more than I had to, truth be told.\" He rubs his fingers together as though remembering an unpleasant sensation. \"The leather felt... warm.\"\n\nFrom somewhere deep in the library, a sound echoes—soft, rhythmic, like pages turning on their own.",
  "planning_block": {
    "thinking": "The adventure begins with two clear hooks: Brenneth's discovery of a mysterious journal connected to the annotations Aric has been studying, and an unexplained sound from deeper in the library. The journal represents a direct lead on forgotten knowledge—exactly what Aric seeks. The sound could be mundane or something far stranger. Brenneth's discomfort suggests the journal may be more than it appears. As a Fighter, Aric is well-equipped for physical danger, but the Athenaeum's mysteries may require careful thinking as much as a strong sword arm.",
    "context": "Opening scene - first adventure hooks presented",
    "choices": {
      "investigate_journal": {
        "id": "investigate_journal",
        "text": "Investigate the Journal",
        "description": "Follow Brenneth to the east corridor to examine the ancient journal he discovered wedged behind the shelf.",
        "pros": ["Direct lead on the forgotten knowledge Aric seeks", "Brenneth can provide context about where he found it", "Controlled environment—still in the library"],
        "cons": ["The warm leather suggests possible enchantment or curse", "May be a trap left by whoever hid it"],
        "confidence": "high",
        "risk_level": "low"
      },
      "follow_the_sound": {
        "id": "follow_the_sound",
        "text": "Follow the Strange Sound",
        "description": "Leave the journal for now and investigate the rhythmic page-turning sound echoing from deeper in the Athenaeum.",
        "pros": ["Could reveal an active presence in the library", "May discover something others have missed", "Element of surprise if something is lurking"],
        "cons": ["Unknown threat level", "Moving away from Brenneth's guidance", "Sound could be a lure"],
        "confidence": "medium",
        "risk_level": "medium"
      },
      "question_brenneth": {
        "id": "question_brenneth",
        "text": "Press Brenneth for More Details",
        "description": "Before rushing off, interrogate the old custodian about the library's history, the missing cataloguers, and what he knows about the Veiled Collection.",
        "pros": ["Gather crucial information before acting", "Brenneth may know more than he's letting on", "No physical risk"],
        "cons": ["The old man may clam up if pressed too hard", "Delays action—the sound may stop or the journal could be disturbed"],
        "confidence": "high",
        "risk_level": "safe"
      },
      "grab_sword_and_do_both": {
        "id": "grab_sword_and_do_both",
        "text": "Gear Up and Head East",
        "description": "Grab your longsword, ask Brenneth to show you the journal on the way, and move cautiously toward the source of the sound—covering both leads at once.",
        "pros": ["Efficient—investigates both hooks simultaneously", "Armed and ready for trouble", "Brenneth as a guide through unfamiliar corridors"],
        "cons": ["Splitting focus between two mysteries", "Dragging the elderly custodian toward potential danger", "May miss details by rushing"],
        "confidence": "medium",
        "risk_level": "medium"
      }
    }
  },
  "god_mode_response": "",
  "entities_mentioned": ["Aric", "Brenneth"],
  "location_confirmed": "The Athenaeum of Veiled Pages",
```
